ygData.subject: Re: Necro overpowering?  Not!
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually you are quite incorrect.  You use LifeDrains.  I think there s also a reason why they aren t resisted at all too, but for the life of me I can t
ygData.messageBody:
Actually you are quite incorrect. You use LifeDrains. I think
there's also a reason why they aren't resisted at all too, but for the life
of me I can't remember the reason. Necromancer DoT spells get resisted an
absurd amount by higher level monsters just like any other spellcasters
spells. What that group did was sic all their pets on the Sand Giants while
using Dark Pact and Allure of Death, then sat there and LifeDrained it. The
Sand Giant couldn't get through the pile of skeleton pets fast enough.

One of our guildmembers and several other 20+ level necromancers
repeated the tactic on a griffin on the Karana Server last night. One died
but they killed the griffin, so it isn't so simple. I believe a couple of
the sand giant party died as well. Its not boring at all because of the
danger involved, especially coordinating the effect. They repeated the
tactic again on an HG and half the team died due to poor coordination (and
probably the higher level of the monster and it may have gotten several
lucky hits in too or something, too many variables) and they were forced to
FEIGN or run.

Cheap? I don't think so. Are you saying six level 20 characters
couldn't take down a level 40 character? Is that why I'm level 18 and I can
still get killed by four or five gnoll GUARDS if my pet is only occupying
one of them? Then of course there's the one to two bubble loss of XP from
being killed by a monster MANY levels below you. If you want to complain
about something, talk about the XP penalties of dying to a blue or green
creature.

Malark on Karana

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Lute Lewis [mailto:pbastard@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 18, 1999 7:37 AM
> To: EQ_spell_research@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] BEWARE OF HAPPY99.exe
>
>
> From: "Lute Lewis" <pbastard@...>
>
>
> >I jsut hope his guy isnt an EQ player...
>
> I fail to see why you would hope he isn't an EQ player. Not
> too many people
> will sign up to this list and not play EQ anyway.
>
> >N.B: a necro jsut let me known that a group of 6 bnecros
> including her
> killed a >Sand Giant in Oasis. 2 Levels 17, 1 Level 18 and 3 levels
> 20...Amazing huh? heh >NEcros are really powerfull. i dont
> have any doubt
> anymore =)
>
> Necros can do this because it is a cheap tactic using DOT spells. Not
> amazing, just the fact that your spells aren't resisted. All
> of my necro
> friends, higher than those you mentioned, don't do this
> because it's cheap,
> boring (it takes forever to kill a level 30+ monster at low
> level), and they
> know they really aren't getting the kill so it's no
> satisfaction for them.
>
> I read today that you can't get level 24+ Magician pets
> until they fix
> it. The fix will be either the research involved in getting
> these pets, or
> adding shops that will just sell them. I'd imagine they would
> add shops
> since the 24 pets are documented in spell lists not as "Mist
> Elemental" and
> what not, but who knows. I have spent 3 levels in South
> Karana trying to get
> aviak feathers, so it's safe to say your chances of getting
> them there are
> slim. I also read about a vendor in a locked hut and a
> Minotaur vendor in
> south karana, supposedly mage releated. Does anyone know about this?
>
>
